name: NOR
description:
A NOR gate can be constructed using NOT and AND gates by following these steps:

* Take two inputs, A and B, and pass them to two separate NOT gates to invert their values. The output of each NOT gate will be the inverse of the input.
* Pass the inverted inputs A' and B' to two separate AND gates. The output of each AND gate will be 1 only if both of its inputs are 1, otherwise it will be 0.
* Pass the outputs of the AND gates to a final OR gate. The output of the OR gate will be 0 only if both of its inputs are 0, otherwise it will be 1.

The resulting circuit will behave like a NOR gate, where the output will be 0 only if both inputs are 1, otherwise it will be 1.
